result.execSummary:
The defendant Tevin Dontrell Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court set restitution at ZERO. 
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of extended supervision in case 13CF3470. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds.

Concurrent with: concurrent to case 13CF3470; straight time; credit for 67 days time served.
No contact with the University of Wisconsin - Milwaukee campus unless enrolled in classes.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tevin Dontrell Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order to Produce for Sentencing Hearing on August 12, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed

Defendant Tevin Dontrell Smith in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Tevin Dontrell Smith in custody.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  State needs to provide victim notification; adjourned date selected.  Parties advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case is reassigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25 in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, TUESDAY, JULY 07, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR 20, SB 113. kl

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Tevin Dontrell Smith not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with UW - Milwaukee

Defendant Tevin Dontrell Smith in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Tevin Dontrell Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
